message_1: Determine a conformal mapping that transforms the unit disk $|z| < 1$ onto the upper half plane $\{z: \mathrm{Im}(z) > 0\}$, and fixes the point $i$.
message_2:
To find a conformal mapping that transforms the unit disk $|z| < 1$ onto the upper half-plane $\{z: \mathrm{Im}(z) > 0\}$ and fixes the point $i$, we can use the following steps:

1. First, map the unit disk to the right half-plane using the MÃ¶bius transformation $w_1 = \frac{z + 1}{1 - z}$. This transformation maps the unit disk to the right half-plane and maps the point $i$ to the point $1 + i$.

2. Next, map the right half-plane to the upper half-plane using the transformation $w_2 = w_1^2$. This transformation maps the right half-plane to the upper half-plane and maps the point $1 + i$ back to the point $i$.

Now, we can combine these two transformations to obtain the desired conformal mapping:

$$w(z) = w_2(w_1(z)) = \left(\frac{z + 1}{1 - z}\right)^2$$

This conformal mapping transforms the unit disk $|z| < 1$ onto the upper half-plane $\{z: \mathrm{Im}(z) > 0\}$ and fixes the point $i$.
